intro: Ludwigia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in wetlands and marshy areas. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It often grows in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and streams. Ludwigia angustifolia is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in aquatic gardens due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
